text: [Music]
a new lead suggests Eldorado could lie
in the lands of the Incas to them it was
known as pi TT the legend was born when
conquistadors imprisoned the Incan
Emperor in exchange for his freedom he
promised a huge gold ransom but he was
double-crossed the Spang has decided it
was too dangerous to let him go so they
accused him of having arranged the
murder of his brother and made for an
excuse to do away with him
according to legend his followers flee
and hide the remaining gold in their
jungle base this is where the legend of
paititi comes from because the rest of
the ransom it never gets paid and the
legend tells us that it remains in the
city the lost city of petit II has a lot
of similarities with the legend of El
Dorado they could be one of the same
countless explorers have searched for
the mysterious City and the gold that is
said to be hidden there so many
explorers have looked for pi TT and not
found it that over time it's been
relegated as myth or legend then in 2001
something extraordinary is found a
document was rediscovered in the Vatican
archives dating back to 1600 it mentions
party T by name and says it's seven
leagues from Cusco guess what it's not
legend it just might be history
and now a new generation of explorers is
using technology to revitalize the
search it all said you know sis your
weave is it an obsession yes but I
believe we've never been so close to
finding this site Thierry Sharmini
believes the city could be hidden in the
jungle north of the Incan capital cuzco
in 2012 jean men commissioned the
satellite to pass over the location he
thinks holds the secret of pi t t v--
but we weren't expecting to find a
mountain with such regular features
we've actually asked ourselves if this
square shaped mountain was 100%
artificial or 100% natural shaman thinks
this square shaped mountain is the
location of the legendary city of
paititi
